intro: Barbosella longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered barbosella, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Barbosella longiflora is often used in native plant gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
